page.title: 02Farming
page.content: The farming in this area is mainly arable undertaken by farmers on their own land, although 17 per cent is undertaken by tenant farmers. The crops are wheat, barley and oil seed rape with some root crops grown to feed the sheep which graze on the rough pasture particularly in the Nene Valley. In the past few years many hedgerows have been uprooted to make bigger fields to enable bigger farm machines to carry out the harvesting. After harvest, in the past few years a pall of thick smoke has hung over the area as the stubble has been burned off. There is no dairy farming in the area. The farmers now working the land have descended from farming families who have worked the land here for generations.
